ISSUE.TITLE: benchmark report 404 on /dir/assign
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Hi, I need some help here. I set up a seaweadfs cluster, which works fine. Passed all my reads/writes tests. But when I run ./weed benchmark command, it reports 100% 404 Not Found on /dir/assign request: ./weed benchmark -server=127.0.0.1:9333 -n=100 ------------ Writing Benchmark ---------- writing file error: http://127.0.0.1:9333/dir/assign: 404 Not Found writing file error: http://127.0.0.1:9333/dir/assign: 404 Not Found ...98 more of this I tested http://127.0.0.1:9333/dir/assign with both curl and browser, it works well: curl http://127.0.0.1:9333/dir/assign {"fid":"9,07a4983afa","url":"someurl:8080","publicUrl":"someurl:18080","count":1} I use version 0.76, linux_arm64.tar.gz my machine runs on Centos7, kernel 4.4.36-1.el7.elrepo.x86_64 thanks in advance

COMMIT.MESSAGE: (fix #543)added body to error when Post encounter 4xx response
Merge pull request #544 from kelgon/master (fix #543)added response body to error when util.Post encounter 4xx response
